title: 2009 CAF Champions League
text:
The 2009 CAF Champions League is the 45th edition of <a href="Africa">Africa</a>'s premier club <a href="association%20football">football</a> tournament organized by the <a href="Confederation%20of%20African%20Football">Confederation of African Football</a> (CAF), and the 13th edition under the current <a href="CAF%20Champions%20League">CAF Champions League</a> format. The winner will participate in the <a href="2009%20FIFA%20Club%20World%20Cup">2009 FIFA Club World Cup</a> and the <a href="2010%20CAF%20Super%20Cup">2010 CAF Super Cup</a>.
Qualification.
Below is the qualification scheme for the competition. Nations are shown according to their <a href="CAF%205-Year%20Ranking">CAF 5-Year Ranking</a> – those with a ranking score have their rank and score indicated:
"Italicised" clubs withdrew without playing.
Bolded clubs received a bye in the preliminary round, entering the tournament in the first round.
Unranked associations have no ranking points and hence are equal 23rd (Malawi – ranked =18th – did not enter a champion this year).
1 The champions of Congo DR, South Africa, Sudan, and Tunisia were not given byes in the first stage although the runners-up were. Unlike European tournaments, seeding within the CAF draws is based on performance in continental tournaments only.
2 The <a href="2007%E2%80%9308%20Egyptian%20Premier%20League">2007–08 Egyptian Premier League</a> runner-up, <a href="Ismaily">Ismaily</a> opted not to enter this competition, choosing instead to play in the <a href="2008%E2%80%9309%20Arab%20Champions%20League">2008–09 Arab Champions League</a>. The third-placed Egyptian side, <a href="Al-Zamalek">Al-Zamalek</a> were not allowed to replace them as the CAF Champions League regulations allow only national champions and runners-up to compete.
3 2008 <a href="R%C3%A9union%20Premier%20League">Réunion Premier League</a> Champion, <a href="JS%20Saint-Pierroise">JS Saint-Pierroise</a>, banned from African club competitions after withdrawing from the <a href="2007%20CAF%20Champions%20League">2007 CAF Champions League</a>.
Qualifying rounds.
Preliminary round.
The preliminary round first legs were played on 30 January – 1 February, and the second legs on 13–15 February 2009.
1 Played over one leg after first leg cancelled due to political violence in Madagascar
Dispensation round.
Two federations inscribed their clubs after the deadline, but were admitted for an intermediate round. However, the winning club could only gain access to the first round if another winning club from the preliminary round withdrew subsequently. The first leg was played on 22 February, and the second leg on 8 March 2009.
As no side withdrew from the first round, <a href="Akonangui%20FC">Akonangui</a> were effectively eliminated as well.
First round.
The first round first legs were played on 13–15 March, and the second legs on 3–6 April 2009.
Second round.
The first leg will be on 17–19 April and the second leg on 1–3 May.
Group stage.
The draw for the group stage was held on 7 May in <a href="Confederation%20of%20African%20Football">CAF</a> headquarters in <a href="Cairo">Cairo</a>.
<a href="Etoile%20sportive%20du%20Sahel">Étoile du Sahel</a> and <a href="Al-Merreikh">Al-Merreikh</a> were seeded as level I, while <a href="TP%20Mazembe">TP Mazembe</a> and <a href="Al-Hilal%20Omdurman">Al-Hilal</a> were seeded as level II.
Knockout stage.
Semifinals.
The first legs were scheduled for 4 October and the second legs for 17–18 October.
Final.
2–2 on aggregate. <a href="TP%20Mazembe">TP Mazembe</a> won on the <a href="away%20goals%20rule">away goals rule</a>.
